text: that is amazing :blush: !  As a life coach, I can tell you that all these characteristics that the advocate type has, are very useful in these careers :smile: When reading through the profile, did you recognise many of these aspects on yourself? If yes, do you think you could use some of the information there in the personal statement if you think they apply? (for example, compassion, connection with people) or in the strengths section where it says creativity, insightfulness etc.
I wouldn't say your interests are ordinary, what kind of books do you like to read usually?
because even the fact that you like watching crime shows - shows the interest you have in criminology and psychology for example

Also, I don't think it's important to focus on standing out, just be yourself and try to gather information that is relative to the course and your personality as this is what is important.. Well, I didn't have to write a personal statement as such, because when I went to uni I came from Greece and they needed me to do some tests and they looked at some preparation i had done here in an institution but I didn't have to write one maybe the system was also a bit different a few years ago.. hehe

But as far as I am concerned, because I have worked with a few students in regards to their personal statement, I understand that what is needed is a few words about yourself as a person, why you are interested in the course and the university
so it would be useful to write about your qualities as a person and why they would bring value to the course for example

when I'm saying I don't think is important to focus on standing out, what i mean is that purely because you have your own thoughts, skills and personality, i believe it's better to focus on showing these and therefore you automatically will stand out as you are unique :relaxed:

Maybe you could start by talking about psychology/criminology as subjects and why you are interested in these, and then add your personal qualities (i.e empathetic-feeling other people's feelings etc. etc.) that are related
even just having the desire to learn about people or helping them would be good to mention
Oh yess, thanks for the idea!! I will add that in the personal statement
I know your a life coach and now a personal development coach, what is your typical working day?
